pullRequest.title: Database Migration acceptance testing - using pre-generated database archives
pullRequest.bodyText:
PR description
This pull request adds a set of acceptance tests that verify that databases in various historical formats can all be loaded and run successfully.
We should run tests against data generated by at least the following versions of Besu:

Before versioning was enabled (Pantheon 1.2.0): pegasyseng/pantheon:1.2.0
After versioning was enabled (Pantheon 1.2.1): pegasyseng/pantheon:1.2.1
After the metadata file location was moved (Besu 1.3.0): hyperledger/besu:1.3.0

This approach is a variant of the approach used in this Pull Request 142. Instead of using Besu import command within a docker container we can simply use pre-generated database archives. Since we are using only the 10 first blocks of Ropsten those archives are very small (approximately 100KB). This technique removes the need to use the import command, as we mentioned above this command gives flakiness in a docker container, making tests non deterministic.
Signed-off-by: Abdelhamid Bakhta abdelhamid.bakhta@consensys.net
Fixed Issue(s)
Fixes Write acceptance tests for db migration
